text: Hey everyone! It's Helen here. Today I will share with you my secret recipe for
caramelized pop bits with quail eggs (looks amazing!!)
This is a central style version of the very popular Vietnamese dish called "thịt kho tàu" which is also
caramelized pork with eggs,
but this one is more compact and concentrated in flavor. Out of the 300
recipes that I have now on my channel, this one is one of my most proud creations
So I hope you can give it a try. let's begin!
For this recipe you will need about 500 grams of pork belly
It's very important that you choose the pork with even amount of pork lean and fat,
because the
caramelized pork fat at the end is the beauty of this dish. Cut into about half an inch or 1 centimeter thick slices
and then cut again into strips. Oh, man
how I love my new knife! With the chic design of the future, it cuts through meat just like butter
I feel like a ninja holding it in the hands!
*Super sneaky ninja music*
Gather the pork in a large mixing bowl, and then add one tablespoon of brown sugar
Mix well and set aside for about 15 minutes in a windy place, this will help
the pork fat to turn translucent when we cook it later
The brown sugar will make the caramelization go faster
if you don't have brown sugar, it's okay just use castor sugar
Then mince some garlic and shallots together, about 1 tablespoon amount and then add to the meat
together with half a teaspoon of salt, a teaspoon of chicken stock and
some pepper. mix well and set aside for about 15 minutes.
Boil the quail eggs, for about four minutes and peel. Then deep fry them for
a wrinkly and chewy skin. You can skip the deep fried parts, ah, if you prefer not to.
Heat the saucepan on medium and sprinkle 1 tablespoon of sugar over the bottom
I don't use any oil for this step because the pot fat later gonna release a lot of fats
When the sugar melts and turns into  amber color, quickly toss in the pork
Cook 50 minutes on medium heat, stirring occasionally to render the fat and caramel lightly
Then add the juice of 1 coconut, which is about 300 ml
And 3 tbsp of fish sauce. Then reduce the heat to very low and keep it simmering for
40 minutes. The sauce will reduce now into a really shiny
beautiful and sticky sauce.
So so so good!
You can serve this in daily Vietnamese meal with other pickle vegetables
with hot steamed rice.
But the best way in my opinion to serve this, is with hot steamed sticky rice
You just drizzle over the top. And you know what make the dish extra good?
Just putting on some roasted sesame seeds. Just a little touch, but really can bring the dish to a whole new level
Let me give it a try. Oh my God look at the pork fat. It's just so so so
translucent and really nicely caramelized.
I know many of you don't like to eat fats, but when you bite into this, you will change your mind
hmm
Mmm~
The porkbits are beautifully glazed with really translucent look and when you bite into it
It's like really glutinous, sticky and a completely different texture than any other kind of pork you've tried before
I'm really proud of this creation and
Please give it a try. Share with me your photo if you do on instagram with #HelenRecipes
I'm so looking forward to seeing them! Also click like and subscribe to my channel for more delicious
Vietnamese food. Thank you for watching!
